subject: p14213287
History: Altered mental status, assess for acute intrathoracic process.
Findings: Lateral views of the chest were obtained. The lungs appear clear bilaterally. The previously detected opacity in the left lower lung appears to have resolved, though evaluation on a chest radiograph is suboptimal to assess complete resolution. Would recommend non-emergent CT of the chest to ensure resolution of the previously detected lingular opacity as well as multiple additional lung nodules described in detail on prior CT chest. Cardiomediastinal sillouhette appears normal. Bony structures are intact.
Impression: No acute findings. Given findings on CT dated, a nonemergent 3 month f/u chest CT is appropriate to ensure complete resolution and/or stability of nodules per guidelines.
